reviews.title: Great location and exceptional value
reviews.text: I stayed at the Golden Temple for 5 days last week and was blown away by the staff and their exceptional service. The hotel itself is in a handy location and considering the price of the rooms you would be pretty hard to please if you rated this place less than very good. If I return to Siem Riep I would definitely stay there again.

The hotel itself is clean and well presented. This is not a chain hotel and the rooms are very Cambodian so you should not be expecting the standard of appointments you would find in a larger chain hotel. However bear in mind that this place is under $100 a night and for the price it is superb. It is always important to have expectations which are commensurate with the price you are paying and in this case the experience far surpasses the expectations!
reviews.title: top value for money

reviews.text: When you arrive the staff immediately find out who you are and address you by name. Our Group had 8 people, and Akim (who works afternoon), was waiting with our list of names firmly committed to memory. She asked 'where is Jim?', 'where is Peter?' etc and also knew our room numbers off by heart.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: We were greeted with a ginger drink and fruit and taken to our rooms. I had the pool view which is extra but suggest you do not get this room type. We were on a high floor and could only see the rooftops whereas our friends who had garden view had a leafy aspect and a more quiet, cooler room. Go the cheaper deluxe garden view.
reviews.title: Visit to Angkor Wat
Magical experience, beautiful setting
reviews.text: The hotel expertly assisted with all restaurant bookings and had tuk tuks available for a small fee.

The hotel is well located and close to Siem Reap center. The staff is very friendly and obliging. They took care of all arrangements for our trip including transport, guides etc. The food was very good. I would stay at this hotel again. The guest relations manager, Thavy, was very friendly and obliging and spoke English well. She would take care of all requests in a cheerful and efficient manner. The spa was well appointed but it does not have private rooms. No fitness center.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and friendly staff
Friendly service in a convenient location
reviews.text: We spent a long weekend with a standard king room. The tuk-tuk was waiting at the airport, and the staff was very friendly and efficient for the checkin. The hotel is 10 minutes from the old market and the two night markets, as well as close to the bars and restaurants in Pub Alley. Other than a slight glitch with the shower, that was resolved quickly, the stay was excellent.

reviews.title: Ten out of ten!
reviews.text: Amazingly friendly staff made our stay simply perfect! The location is great and only a very short stroll to the town centre. Breakfast, lunch or dinner here is also wonderful and the outlook over the pool is a nice way to spend a lazy hour or so. Try a massage here each afternoon as its a great way to unwind and the staff do a fabulous job. Overall this property certainly exceeded our expectations and is due entirely to the amazing staff throughout the property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A big thank you from Leane and
reviews.title: Great little Hotel

reviews.text: myself for your kind and warm hospitality.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with Remarkable Service!
Great value, even better service
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights in October based on excellent reviews on trip advisor. The hotel is very homey with traditional Asian decor. It appears old but I feel like it only adds to its charm. It is located pretty close to the pub street/night market where most of the tourists go at night. If it weren't for the heat and dusty roads, I think this would have been a 10 min walk at the most. Or a $2 tuktuk ride. The biggest strength of this hotel is its staff. Being Asian, I am used to and have come to expect good hospitality wherever I go, but the hotel staff just exceeded expectations. Every time we walked in the lobby, we were greeted by our first names, complete with iced tea and cold towels. They also have a pool onsite which can get crowded at the end of the day when everyone comes back from visiting the temples and it can be difficult finding seats. There is a restaurant that serves both western and Khmer meals. The breakfast buffet is very limited, granted that it is free. But all in all, I think this was a great find with excellent value for money. I would stay here again.

All the good reviews are true. They have a clean and nice pool with jacuzzi, rooms have romantic settings and I have only nice words for the staff from reception to restaurant to room service. Everyone was just willing to help...You can't go wrong with this hotel.
reviews.title: Great service at this romantic hotel

reviews.text: Golden Temple Is a real gem in Siem Reap. Excellent value for your dollar. Nothing is too much trouble for the warm and welcoming staff. Special props to Ms. Akhin at the front desk!
reviews.title: Best hotel of my 4-week trip.
Amazing little hotel!
reviews.text: I stayed here for five nights. A couple of those were rainy, so decided to stay in. The on-site restaurant/bar is really quite good, and priced very nicely, also.

reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay
reviews.text: As a side note, I would like to also recommend Peace of Angkor tours. Especially If you have interest in photography. They will allow you to customize a tour exactly to your likings, and take you to the sites at optimum times to avoid crowds, and to see some real life in Cambodia.

Only been open for 3 years. Tailored for tourist including meals on the run for you to be available the day of. got the free airport pickup. Beds are flat and amazingly comfortable. Slept very well. Place looks really nice. Service is great. The tut tuts for the hotel are very friendly. We did the massages which are so cheap for 1 hour about $5. Not to miss. Pool was perfect, internet was strong. Video about Angkor wat was informative
reviews.title: Perfect for tourist

reviews.text: Visited Siem Reap and the temples of Angkor in mid-October. The hotel had been recommended by friends who had stayed there on an earlier trip. Though small, the hotel staff are courteous, always smiling and pay close attention to detail to make your stay hassle free. From organising tours to the famous sights, organising tour guides and transport and even providing packed meals for early morning trips or lunches, no request went without the hotel providing a solution. The hotel restaurant and pool are perfect for a relaxed evening after a long day at the temples, and I believe the spa and massages too were wonderful.
reviews.title: Charming hotel
exceptional staff
reviews.text: The room was neat and adequate with a balcony, though the chairs on the balcony were a bit uncomfortable! Cable TV and a decent wifi connection made the stay perfect. Only suggestion would be to change the basin tap to avoid water splashing everywhere! But these are minor, given the overall ambiance and comforts available, and the great price and airport transfers, free meal and spa treatment included in the price.

reviews.title: Holiday at Siem Reap
reviews.text: The location is a big plus point as well - just ten minutes walk to the night market and pub street and restaurants. And the people in Siem Reap too are very pleasant and unassuming and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great trip and would highly recommend the Golden Temple Hotel for visitors to Siem Reap and Angkor. Would definitely stay there again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Value Small Hotel
